Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great price”
Reviews.Author: jtfo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and modern. Staff are very helpful and speak English. The area is safe and there are a few restaurants and bars around. Personally I didn't and wouldn't go for the breakfast, its cheaper to get something from one of the patisseries on the way to the metro station. It's a 10 min walk to the metro and once there easy to get round the city. It cost us 37€ for unlimited use of the metro for 2 for three days, which is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CaroleandPhil
Reviews.Content: Having been priced out of the hotels we used on previous trips, we found this newly opened hotel through Tripadvisor and can only agree with the other excellent reviews. Perhaps it is a little off the beaten track, but it is in a very pleasant area, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great too. Would look no further for a place to stay on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gareth_Y_Cymro
Reviews.Content: The Home Moderne is a very new, clean and value for money hotel. The rooms are comfortable and quiet and there is free wifi throughout the hotel. Combine these aspects with the amazing price - I paid 75 euros for a double room and you are onto a winner! Friendly staff that are always polite. A pleasure to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, A Little out of the way, tiny rooms, poor facilities and service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Ant_and_Kresta
Reviews.Content: Our party of nine stayed at this hotel for two nights in June 2011. I booked the hotel after reading the multitude of positive reviews on tripadvisor, combined with the hotels photographs, I thought that for the price it was too good to be true. The price was excellent for paris so the hotel really can not be criticised in this respect. I must say that we did not find our stay particularly enjoyable. The hotel is quite a way out of the city but we knew this prior to booking, and the area is actually quite nice. It is away from the hustle and bustle in a more residential area, surrounded by an abundance of French bakeries and Cafes. The train station is a pleasant walk away and from there it is only a short trip to a lot of the major sight-seeing areas. The hotel itself does not have any facilities as such, there is an overpriced continental breakfast which consists of a few different types of pastries and filtered coffee, there is a much better selection at the surrounding shops. There are no in-room fridges, and hardly space in the tiny rooms to open your suitcase, and the bathroom and shower are the smallest I have ever experienced. You literally can not spend any time in your room. The bed is also very poor quality and has cheap low-quality bedding. I understand that we were in France, but the front desk attendants are unable to understand English, and did not book our early-morning cab to take us to the airport, even though we requested it and confirmed it twice. There is also no English television channels whatsoever. I do not want to come accross as an ignorant English-speaker but it makes your stay extremely hard if you are unable to be understood by the people who work in the hotel. All in all it was an average stay, hence the 3/5 rating. I do wish I would have spent the extra money and stayed at a slightly more upmarket hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but still a cozy place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Squeegie
Reviews.Content: I was at the Home Moderne for two nights back in March of 2011. It's definitely off the beaten path and not in the most Metro-accessible location (although there are bus lines nearby, and you're still a ten-minute walk away from two Metro lines and the tram). That said, it is refreshing to be away from the hustle and bustle of central Paris when you're just looking to chill, as I was. The hotel definitely lives up to its name - it is top-notch on the inside, short of lavish but still new, chic, and cozy. Its amenities more than make up for what it lacks in location. Perhaps best of all, it was a steal of a deal, very reasonably priced against comparable hotels. you could stay in a worse hotel somewhere in the inner ring of arrondissements, but it would probably set your budget back at least twice as much. So, to sum up, if you don't mind being in a peaceful area of the 15th but still within striking distance of Paris's "greatest hits" and are looking for a hotel that's got plenty going for it and won't break your bank, chances are the Home Moderne is your kind of place! Will I be back soon? Mais bien sur, mes amis!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie k
Reviews.Content: I had spent hours and hours reading hotel reviews on here, and checking various hotel prices before finally deciding on this hotel, so I thought it is about time i start leaving reviews too! My gf and I recently spent five days at this hotel. The bathroom was very clean (my gf insists on clean bathrooms), rooms were adequately sized and my overall impression was of high satisfaction.. The cleaners were very thorough (BUT watch out for the cheap poor quality loo-rolls....) It was the coldest week of feb, but the heating was perfect. We were handed a wifi password- but we didnt follow up on it as we hadn't brought a laptop. Some people have mentioned on here the fact that this place is not central so I was a bit apprehensive, but to be honest the 10-15 minute walk to the metro was no big deal. We actually enjoyed the short walks because it gave us a chance to check out the local area for cafes and restaurants and pop into the local boulangeries and just generally soak in the non-touristic parisian life! There is a kettle in the room, and as others have commented, the coffee/tea is not replenished. Being a caffeine junky, I was worried about this after reading the review, but I simply popped into a local supermarket and stocked up on these essentials, as well as a pint of longlasting milk. simples..! Pick up some bread or patisseries from either of the two boulangeries that are within a stone's throw, and you won't need their expensive 8 euro breakfast..... Noisewise.. as it was a valentine's citybreak, I had been looking for somewhere where my hotel neighbours wouldnt give us the evil look in the morning for keeping them awake...(!) I would say the room was fine on this aspect. My room was next to the stairway, and therefore no neighbours directly adjoining. We could hear pple walking in the stairway or corridor though, so I wouldnt say the place is soundproof, but you don't get the impression that someone will overhear you all night, if you get my drift. I definitely recommend it for the value for money aspect, when you compare it to any that are at a similar or slightly higher cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Neatham
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in a triple room on the 7th floor. It was clean, quiet and altogether a very pleasant experience. There were a kettle and a little fridge in the room, and lots of shops nearby selling orange juice, milk, teabags etc which is very convenient. It's really great value compared to the many expensive Paris hotels. I'd recommend the restaurant Le Trotteur which is just 5 minutes down rue Brancion. Turn left when you leave the hotel and walk 5 minutes south. Le Trotteur has pastas, pizzas and salads, all at very reasonable prices. Gare Montparnasse and the Catacombs at Denfert Rochereau are about 20 minutes walk from Hotel Home Moderne.

Reviews.Title: “For this price, all very good!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteLiliya
Reviews.Content: Paid for a room 58 euros per night. For this price, all very good. Clean room, clean bathroom. We had a room on the 6th floor. The windows looked out onto the street at night noisy. The room was safe, air conditioning and tea. Some of the rooms on the 6th and 7th floor have a balcony. The area is very good. Many cafes, restaurants, post office, supermarket 5-7 minutes walk away. At the corner of good wine shop. Before the subway 15 minutes walk to city center 20 minutes. A very good night porter. The reception staff are help and quickly solve problems. The maid was cleaning nice, but I tried to get into the room where hung the sign "Do Not Disturb."

Reviews.Title: “Really good budget hotel. Wish there were more like this.”
Reviews.Author: ruby_storm
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't in the epicentre of Paris, but it doesn't really matter in my opinion as the transport links to it are great. It's a 10 minute walk to Convention or Porte de Vanves. On top of that you have a brilliant bus (95) that takes you to all the main attractions which is super close to the hotel. The area around the hotel feels really safe, and clean. The hotel is simple and clean and does the job. The staff are friendly and are very keen to give you a map and show you how to get to the sights. If you just want somewhere quiet, safe, clean and convenient to rest your head each night, this is it. If you want somewhere swanky, with a huge bed and 40000 TV channels, this probably isn't. For me and my boyfriend, who only wanted to use it as somewhere to sleep after sightseeing all day and night, it was perfect! The problem with budget hotels is that so many are awful, truly awful, that they let the side down. This budget hotel does exactly what it says on the tin, nothing more nothing less, and that's brilliant for the price you pay. I'd use it again and recommend to friends. Don't bother with the breakfast- tons of amazing bakeries around you'd wish you'd have gone to instead!

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 (2 adults, 2 children, 1 baby)”
Reviews.Author: objectmaster
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not big for American standards, but for European standards it is normal. The rooms have A/C, TV, Safe, etc. We had to take 2 rooms, my wife and my oldest son and the baby slept in one room. I shared the other room with my middle boy. It was more than big enough for all of us. I agree with other reviewers, it is a good 15 minutes from the metro. So its a good walk, which you have to do twice a day. However, along the way is a supermarket and local bakery. You also get a good feeling for the local life which is a valuable impression. The area seemed safe to us, even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: pypmannetjies
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is very small, but the view from the window was very charming. The room was cleaned daily. The heating was good and there is a small kettle for coffee or tea. The wifi wasn't working on the fourth floor, so we had to go downstairs to use it. Getting a data package for your phone in Paris is extremely frustrating, so the wifi was a great help. The shower's door had come off and was replaced by a shower curtain, which was a bit annoying. There's also a safe for your valuables. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke English as well as French. The area is nice - two people were very friendly and helped us with directions to the hotel. The hotel isn't too far away from the sights (and still in zone 1 for a Paris Visite travel card).

Reviews.Title: “Near perfection for our budget!”
Reviews.Author: Knight_1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here 26/12/11-30/12/11. The positives: Very clean rooms Friendly, efficient and knowledgeable reception staff Nearest Metro 15 min walk away (Convention) Not a touristy area (the real locals Paris) Friendly locals Felt safe at night Great selection of restaurants within walking distance to suit every taste and budget The negatives: Room 401 was very small, thin walled & right next to stairs (could hear everything) Breakfast was self service (cook your own eggs,toast etc) Breakfast waitress was unhelpful and a little rude You have to pay for a refill of tea & coffee for your room In the bigger picture you can see that the positives outweigh the negatives, and for the price we paid to be in Paris my husband and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and doesn't mind walking a little and we are sure that these little negatives can be easily smoothed out and we would be happy to return to Hotel Moderne in the near future. We recommend: Trying a pizza at the local pizza restaurant - just a few doors away from the hotel, traditional (Italian) stone baked pizza's and very friendly, courteous staff. The restaurant to look at is nothing special but the food is delicious! Le Luna restaurant - Traditional Parisian cuisine a few doors up from the restaurant. Very chic and full of friendly locals who are happy to help you with the menu and give you information of the history of the local area. - Be warned though, as this is not a typical fast paced tourist area don't expect a fast paced city like service. These lovely locals are very relaxed and this shows in their approach to service, you may find yourself enjoying soaking up the Parisian atmosphere and wine! If not your style there is always McDonalds! Also be aware of beggars who pretend (or maybe not) to be deaf & dumb by the Eiffel Tower, they can surround you (up to 6/7) at a time and could easily pick pocket you if your not careful! PLEASE REMEMBER! We only found out on our last meal out, but when you receive a bill you will find a breakdown of VAT and service charge added which is always combined within the price of the meal - So if you wish to leave a tip then as we were told this is an added bonus to the already existing hidden service charge, so maybe 1-3 euros should suffice. We really hope this helps with choosing this hotel/area to stay, Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raimonds B
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel for a very reasonable price. We're prepared to get worse than it turned out. Responsive staff. Quiet street. Very convenient that the room has a kettle: coffe-time can be arranged at any time. Free WiFi. The nearest metro station Plaisance (Line 13) and Convencion (line 12), is in about 10 minutes. After a day of walking around the city that seemed far away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Service? See who you meet”
Reviews.Author: HazeSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in December based on TA's recommendation.   It's clean, looks new and in a good neighborhood with bakeries etc. great value.  Downside :  1) you get great service if William or Zacky is at the desk. If it happens to be Gilles or Claire, go back another time. On two occasions I have requested that Gilles booked the airport shuttle for me. On both occasions (both at about 9 pm),he said come back the next morning to ask the colleague in the morning shift. I told him your brochure displayed on the front desk said the booking hotline opens till 11pm. He was stumped and said the information is wrong. Please, it's a brochure framed next to your TA award. One evening I asked if his colleague in the morning shift left any message to confirm my airport shuttle, he said again come back next morning and when I insisted that he checks the message booklet he started mumbling in French with a clearly irritated face(cursing or what I dont know)  On another night I called from room to clarify how to make a local call. His set of instructions were the same as I previously did. In any case I tried, didn't work, called the front desk again a few times and he longer answers it.  I am out of hotel from 8 am to 9 pm so if Gilles is not night shift (which he was on most nights), I get no help.  I also tried asking Claire to book airport shuttle. She called one provider which was unavailable and proceeded to book a cab, only Zacky tried two other companies. When I asked if she could call more providers, she gave a couple of "I don't know ".  So if you don't need to struggle with heavy luggage and bad service from some staff, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nina C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September. Great hotel! Spacious, clean and cosy room, clean and comfortable bathroom with modern facilities, friendly and courteous staff. The hotel is rather far away from the center, but there is a stop near it. A bus takes you straight to the Louvre or the Pantheon. The metro is in 15 minutes walk. Near the hotel there is a park, a large grocery store and cooking. Booking on offers is a good opportunity to get excellent accommodation for the low price. We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely great value hotel in nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Saphy J
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Stayed in a twin room with my best friend and the rooms are big enough for two people. Rooms cleaned well everyday. Decent sized bathroom with good shower. Large wardrobe big enough for all our belongings and a safe for valuables inside it. Also a television which was free and picked up many channels if you want a lazy evening. Great value room for a decent sized room in Paris. Not too far from metro station to get to the main tourist attractions, and very close to restaurants, shops and express supermarkets. Neighbourhood quite quiet, not as busy as the centre of Paris, and it felt safer too. Would definitely stay here again and I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wolfSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Home Moderne for a week in October 2011. This is a great value for Paris. The room, while not large, was bigger than other hotels in Paris that we have used. It was big enought for our bags, for a table for the computor, and for us to keep out of each other's way. The bath was the same, not large, but adequate for two old people. The room was quiet, probably I asked for one, it was is the back of the hotel and the hotel's location. The reception staff spoke English and were helpful when we asked for information or recommendations . Breakfast was 8 euros and worth it. The location on rue Brancion is a residential area. There are a couple grocery stores close by from a small one open all the time 20 feet away to a very large one with everything 500 yards away. There are at least 6 pastisseries within a quarter mile, one open any day of the week, and half our breakfasts were simply delicious. There are several very good restaurants, in the 65 to 76 euro for two range, within walking distance Two buses run by the front door, both from Montparnasse train station but different routes. The only down side is the nearest metro station, in fact there are three stations, are one third of a mile away. A bus runs on rue de Vouille, 250 yards away, to the most convenient station, Convention, every ten minutes or so. Rue de Vouille is a shopping street with open markets twice a week and a wonderful walk if the weather is good. On a last note, the hotel does not have any stars on the front. This might be because it looks like it has just been remodelled. It should be a two star( ensuite rooms and an elevator) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mehmet c
Reviews.Content: Even if the rooms are a bit small like all Paris city hotels, that was a very clean hotel and transportation is easy, 3-4 mn. wlk to tramway and metro and a bus going to Louvre and Opera Building passes just in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A suite, for the price of a Single in the middle of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: 1stGenRex
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews, and was sad to see people have crazy expectations. They want a hotel in the middle of Paris, with giant rooms, for less than 300 Euro a night? It's not going to happen. Hotel Home Modern is not in the middle of Paris, but that's why it appealed to me. The area is quiet, and not quite as busy as other areas in Central Paris. The Metro is not close, but it's not very far either. We were there for 5 days, and bought the Unlimited metro pass, which was a life saver. There wasn't a single day where we didn't take the over the road tram (which is about a 10 minute walk) to one of the metro stations. If you can't walk more than 10 minutes, honestly, Paris is not for you. Anyway, more on the hotel...on the exterior, looking at it, you wouldn't know what to expect, but once you get inside, you get the feeling that it really is a lot more modern than what the building appears to be. The lady at the front desk was VERY helpful, and spoke English very well. Once we got to our room, we were even more pleasantly surprised. You see, in Paris, hotels are not usually in new buildings, and Paris is one of the most visited places in the world, so hotel rooms are small, to get the most out of buildings. For what a single cost in the middle of Paris, you get a very modern, clean, and comfortable "suite". There's no microwave in the room, which is the only thing we wish we would have had, but the mini fridge is decent, the bed is comfortable, and the bathroom (with a separate toilet) was very nice. There's a bakery in the corner, which is quite good. There's also a bar/cafe across from that who serves a pretty good bacon cheeseburger and fries. A couple doors down, there's a fruit and vegetable stand, with a small convenience store inside, and there are a few restaurants before you reach the end of the block. There's also a laundromat on the same block, which is quite convenient. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend Hotel Home Modern. My wife and I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of walk from metro but room is comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MissHo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel du Home Moderne for one night at the end of October. The hotel is located in a residential area with many shops, bakeries, restaurants, supermarkets and even a park nearby. Not too close to the metro stations but if you don't mind a bit of walking, you might even enjoy getting around in this residential area amongst the local people. But if you are travelling with big luggages, walking there from the metro may be challenging. The hotel itself is very nice and looks new and well-kept. The room is small but pretty much everything you need is here: free wi-fi, flat screen TV with CNN, hair dryer and even a hot water kettle which I love. I paid 93 euro for one night. For a Friday night in Paris, that's good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Jonniehekyl
Reviews.Content: I wanted to rate it 3.5/5 but it wont let me select half a circle! Good price... we paid 85 euro a night in november. The room is small, but i assume that's normal in Paris. Literally just enough room for the bed, bathroom and table. It's noisy.... when your roomate goes to the bathroom, you can hear it. When the people above you, or next to you, or across the narrow hall from you are getting it on... you can hear it ALL. I think the walls are paper thin. Recently I've became a buffet breakfast enthusiast! This Bfast was a 2.5/5. An expensive 8 euro and not much selection compared with other hotels, when i asked for a second cup of tea they said simply "there is none left". It didnt seem like a busy morning and we were eating at a peak time. Can get some AMAZING pastries nearby for 1 Euro. Coffee is expensive in the area at 4.5 euro. There is a GREAT fruit shop just across the road. I recommend that. Staff were great, friendly and helpful. Rooms and lobby are in good condition. Lobby looks recently redone. The room was clean and in between new and old. Wouldn't like to stay there with a family, but hotel is good for a trip when you only need a place to sleep and shower. Is a bit away from the city centre but public transport is good and frequent. NOTE THAT AT THE TRAIN STOP CALLED 'CONCORDE' (LOUVRE, CHAMP ELYSEES ETC) THE LEFT HAND TICKET ENTRANCE MACHINE IS BROKEN AND YOU CAN GET THROUGH IT FOR FREE. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “your home away from home”
Reviews.Author: stireciu
Reviews.Content: Although 1st time in Paris this hotel turned out to be a great choice. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. If I come the 2nd time I'll check in there for sure. Small rooms (but hey, you're in Paris, for Christ sake) but clean and cosy. No mold or tobacco smoke smell. Backyard rooms very quiet. Breakfast repetitive but fresh and tasty. Staff very friendly. Nearby Cent Kilos restaurant very good. If you can manage not to go crazy about crossing the Montparnasse Bienvenue subway station anywhere you go, then it is well connected to the most important turist attractions. Very safe area around it.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, but PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: livinginmunich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the city center, but in a great neighborhood and priced just right. The street to the Metro is lined with bakeries and shops, perfect for a morning cup of coffee and rolls. The shop owners and cafes in the area were very kind, regardless of our lack of french - great out of the way shops where we rarely left without buying something! The hotel rooms are small, but clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. This was my third trip to Paris, if there's a fourth in my future I would surely book again from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected and all we needed!”
Reviews.Author: CFehr
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? First of all, the reviews on TripAdvisor are incredibly precise. I booked based on these reviews and we were not disappointed. Pros: - The entire hotel is very clean and well-presented. - Staff are friendly, even if required to speak English in order to avoid my awful attempts at French. - Excellent value. - Safe, friendly neighbourhood. - Free Wi-Fi in hotel rooms. Strong connection. (Get log-in details from reception.) - BBC World and CNBC in English on a nice TV. - Location: We had breakfast every day from the two excellent brasseries and the fruit stand nearby. We had dinner most nights from one of the three excellent pizza restaurants nearby. We bought snacks and lunches from the two marches (supermarkets) nearby. (And when I say 'nearby' I mean on the same street as the hotel! All of which are affordable, friendly and top quality.) Also, there is a really nice, family-friendly park across the street. Cons: - Location: This is debatable. Whilst the local metro station (Porte de Vanves) is a short walk away, most sights required changing trains at least once or twice. This amounts to a 30-45 minutes at the beginning and end of each day. How well you cope with this will depend on your circumstances. We are a 30-ish old couple and it was fine. An older couple or young family might find this to be hard work. Finally, I'll say this might just be the Paris Metro. Almost everywhere we went required 1 or 2 line changes. Look into the 95 bus if you get a chance. I think we might have missed a trick here. - As others mention, they only provide tea/coffee in the room on the first night. Henceforth, you can replenish the supply for 50 cents from reception. We found this a bit odd. - The room was small, but we didn't find this to be a problem. Big windows which open widely ensure fresh air and it doesn't feel claustrophobic. - I can't think of anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lela_b_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October of 2011, the staff was really friendly, the room is tinyyyy, but very clean, and the bathroom was very clean as well - always appreciated. The room was small, but this is kind of a European standard - we were out sight seeing most of the time anyway, and just slept there. The location is so-so - it's about a half hour walk / public transit ride to get to the different sight-seeing spots in the city - which is not bad at all. Best way to get on their public transit system is to walk south on Brancion to Boulevard Lefebvre, to catch the T3 tramway (towards Porte D'Ivry), which then takes you to the nearest subway station - Porte de Vanves on the light blue line -13. Paris subway is old & smelly, but more efficient than most other systems - it will get you to where you need to go. I would definitely stay at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - More than a 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saeed_Masoudi
Reviews.Content: As we read the good reviews on Tripadvisor, we planned to book a quad-room in this hotel. The hotel is fully renovated and we enjoyed our stay at the clean, equipped room at the sixth floor with an excellent view of the street. We also had Wi-Fi internet access with acceptable speed. Although the metro and tram stations are not close to the hotel, the bus line 95 was a good transportation choice to visit the attractions of Paris. Totally I recommend this hotel especially to group of friends up to 4 persons because of its fair price and good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: kristin s
Reviews.Content: The hotellrooms are small but werry nice! The bathroom is brand new, and the rooms are really clean and modern. The hotell is in a bad location far from the city, so if you dont have a car, it can be hard to travel around. But if you chose comfort instead of location, this is a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, modern and clean hotel slightly outside of city centre Paris”
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something at a reasonable cost that doesn't have to be too close to the city centre then this hotel is very good. Price was very good for Paris and though location is out of the "centre" it was only a 10-15 minute Metro ride to the Eiffel Tower from the nearest Metro Stop (which is around a 10 minute walk). The area was very quiet at night (so no night distrurbance) and the street to walk to the Metro along was lovely with lots of patisseries and a sunday market so breakfast was very easy (and very tasty!) We chose to eat close to the hotel only one night, which is fine as there are several places to choose from a few minutes walk away on the main street (which also had a super market, very useful for snacks/drinks before a day out in Paris) It was also easy to eat out in the centre most evenings as the Metro back runs late. Two Metro stops are also available from the Hotel (Convention and Plaisance) enabling easy access to the other Metro lines and all the sites. Room was quite small and the bathroom could do with a little more storage space, but for the price it was fine and was very clean. The size is probably usual for a city hotel. Bathroom facilities were very good and there was a small wardrobe and safe in the room. Staff were helpful with my somewhat broken French speaking and replied in English when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zeffro
Reviews.Content: The location is a little far off, but it was partially our mistake we didn't familiarize with the bus routes but instead opted for the metro. We were only there for a day, otherwise we would have taken the bus the next day. The metro was quite far away. Also, the location is very hard to find since there are 2 streets called Rue Brancion which run parallel. First timers, should take a cab from the airport. The hotel was small, but was very clean and maintained. Reception staff was nice, although we didn't have too much interaction with them. The rooms were very well kept. Very clean and tidy. Small, but convenient. There's no AC or fan in the room! Fortunately, the weather was quite chilly, so keeping the window open just a crack was good enough to cool the room. Bathrooms are very small! Overall, very good value for money. If you are looking for a clean hotel within budget, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Met every expectation.”
Reviews.Author: jmason63
Reviews.Content: We chose this nice hotel based on the other reviews. The information was accurate and every expectation was met. The neighborhood is lovely and feels authentic. Because of the location, don't plan on taking a mid-day break at your hotel; rest in a park or cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: leclosy
Reviews.Content: We tried to find a clean hotel that was reasonably priced,....and suceeded! Most Parisian hotels have dirty, old carpeting and leave much to be desird. Not here!!! The hotel appears to be almost new, is impeccably clean. Our room was quite spacious,and well equipped. The staff at the reception desk were very helpful. They even had a plug adaptor for American plugs! BUT the hiotel is somewhat off the city center. We did however find a bus, no 95, that goes from the Louvre almost to the door of the hotel via Montparneasse in about 20 minutes! Alternatively the nearest metro stations are about 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for paris, a bit out of the way though.”
Reviews.Author: leemondthefirst
Reviews.Content: Ok, start with the negatives, there is only really 2. First is the location, it is a bit of a hassle to get into the 'Touristy' central area of Paris on the Metro, although there is a bus (95) from outside which goes into the centre, but we did not use this. At the end of a long day of walking, you don't feel like getting 2 trains and a walk before you can rest in your room. Convention station is about an 8 minute walk away, I would suggest this stop over Plaisance as the area is much nicer. Montparnasse is also about 15 minutes walk, and this has alot of lines to choose from. Most of the popular parts of Paris are not more than 20 mins away on the Metro from Convention. Second was they don't refill the tea/coffee/hot chocolate, which isn't a major issue, unless of course, you drink alot of this stuff or put them into your bag regularly. Everything else was excellent. The room is modern, clean, smallish, but easily big enough for 2 with plenty of room around the bed, a desk, chair and wardrobe. Bathroom is large, modern and clean with a good shower. Wall mounted LCD, lots of channels, only 2 in English but you're in France, aircon was also in the room which worked very well. It was very quiet from street noise, but the walls are not thick, we could hear water, and any bumps from rooms attached to ours. I found the bed fine and had a good nights sleep every night. Outside of the rooms, reception staff were all very nice and helpful, spoke English when required and didn't mock when we attempted to speak French. They have a free baggage storage area which is handy. We didn't eat here as there are patisseries everywhere, although we couldn't find a takeaway coffee nearby. The area is quite residential, a park nearby, street stalls and restaurants are all on the way to Convention station. As mentioned, I would use Convention station for the Metro as the area is nicer, Plaisance is the other sttaion nearby, but the area feel and looks more dirty and dodgy. The Pizza place down the street a bit has Wood Fired Pizzas and the owners are very nice and friendly. Overall, if you can deal with not being in the centre of Paris, you won't find many better value Hotels in Paris, we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HodonWard
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the 15th arrondissement of Paris, in a rather nice area. The Hotel is very clean, well kept and nicely finished. Distance from the nearest metro is 15 - 20 minutes on foot (Vanves or Convention) - the only drawback. The rest I recommend it to all those looking for a central hotel, at competitive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for supersaver.”
Reviews.Author: cy_mika
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room,nice room setting,convenient,effecient receptionists especially a girl who is working in the afternoon;very friendly and helpful, variety choices of food available near the hotel, near to a mart where you can get your food easily which is just 30 secs walking distance and a fruit stall beside the hotel.The money we paid for it was worth it especially for supersavers like us.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: snowcountry_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a resident area so we really felt like Parisians. We walked to the Tram each day and passed 3 pastry shops on the way. There was a beautiful park 1 block away. We found great choices for cares....especially 1 block away on the corner. The staff was very gracious & worked with our English questions.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Shi_2102
Reviews.Content: I can't really think about any drawbacks. This hotel isn't in the center but it's still 1st zone, which is really important. Metro station is around 10 min walk from the hotel (Plaisance if I remember the writing correctly) but it's straight road and surrounding is so Parisian that it's good thing in the morning. Bus stop is really close but when metro is more comfortable. Room where me and my friend stayed looked exaxtly the same as on photos, bed was comfortable. It must be said that room (at least the one I was in - comfortable with one double bed) is quite small but big enough for two people especially when the only thing you do there is sleep :P I think important thing is also that I wasn't afraid to leave my laptop when we went out. It's France so receptionists didn't talk fluent English but they were really nice and helpful. I definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great refuge from the hustle and bustle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zeex
Reviews.Content: Day after day of fighting the crowds, heat, sweat and extremely non-child-friendly Parisian public transport system, there is no better way to get out of it all and into this extremely affordable and value-for-money boutique hotel. Rooms were functionally and tastefully equipped. The guy at the reception on the evening shift was made the trip a tad more pleasant with his excellent English and enthusiastic hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wanderear
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night for work in local area. Very nice new clean decor, room comfortable and quiet. Breakfast standard but ok but coffee machine coffee not that great. Free wifi useful, staff friendly and mostly speak English. Transport links to centre not brilliant but enjoyed the local restaurants and park, feels like real Paris

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: DinahTate
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August, in a 'comfort double' room. It was fine for me, although two people might have had difficulty walking round each other due to the size, especially in the shower-room where I had to sit sideways on the WC. I paid about €50 a night for room only, which is pretty good for Paris in August. I arrived after midnight but had no problem getting in. The staff are helpful and speak English. The public areas of the hotel are also attractively decorated, and there are useful maps you can help yourself to. NB you get tea/coffee in the room but this is only for the first night, ie they don't replenish it. I found the room a little warm but solved this problem by leaving the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Home Moderne”
Reviews.Author: Andres M
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at Home Moderne during March 2011 in Paris as part of our honey moon. The hotel is very well located, near a metro station, thus easy to reach from any airport and easy to go to any turistic area. It is placed in a quite and nice nieghborhood. We booked a suit room, which was cozy, clean and very confortable. It had TV, electric kettle and the bath room was well equiped too. The personnel was also friendly and warm. We´ve already recommended it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value Anywhere in Paris”
Reviews.Author: swatkins01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 15 days in Paris, and we stayed at Hôtel Home Moderne the entire time. First, the hotel is spotlessly clean. The rooms are cleaned daily, and it is a real cleaning (floors swept/mopped, bathroom thoroughly cleaned, etc.), not the typical "swap out the towels and make the bed" that so many hotels do. The room was not large, but the size was more than adequate for two people. When you consider that you are in Paris and hanging around in a hotel room is not why you come to Paris, the room size is not an issue at all. The hotel was completely remodeled in 2009 and looks brand new. Check it out on Google Street View and you will see that it was in the process of renovation when the Google car drove by! The hotel is air conditioned, which is very important if you are visiting in July or Aug. Many hotels whose rates are several times those of Hôtel Home Moderne do not have a/c. The hotel is located in a very safe, quasi-residential, middle-class neighborhood, not too distant from the major sights of Paris. The benefit of this is that you are amongst Parisians going about their daily business rather than being surrounded by tourists and the obnoxious establishments catering to them (trinket shops, bland overpriced Americanized restaurants, etc.). There is an excellent LCD TV in the room, though only 2 English-language stations (BBC World and CNBC Europe). Free Wi-Fi worked very well, no problems. The bed was very comfortable, with just the right firmness to suit us. The size seemed equivalent to a Queen bed in the U.S. The hotel was very quiet; even though we stayed for 15 days, we were rarely disturbed by other guests or outside noises. There is a breakfast available for 8€, but we did not eat there, preferring to buy something from the local bakeries instead. Check-in was very smooth. We arrived a day early and were fully prepared to get a different hotel for the night until our reservation began, but reception was able to get us into our room early, and was happy to do so. We were able to check in immediately despite having arrived at 10 in the morning! During our 15 days, we encountered at least 5 or 6 different staff at the front desk, and they all spoke English and were exceptionally courteous. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day. Disregard the comments about long walks to the Métro. Tram line 3 has a stop at the end of Rue Brancion, 4 blocks away. It is clear from reading the reviews that some reviewers are not aware of this. It was only a 5-minute walk, even while pulling luggage. If even that walk is too far for you, there is a bus that stops every 10-15 minutes right across the street from the hotel, and it takes you to the Brancion Tram stop. If you buy the Paris Visite unlimited Métro passes (which I highly recommend), they give you unlimited trips on the Métro, Trams, and buses. The tram takes you to many destinations and also connects with several Métro stations, RER lines B and C, and another Tram line. The hotel website does not mention the Tram, but the brochures available at the hotel do. Most of the major tourist destinations are less than 25 minutes away from the hotel door by Tram/Métro. Getting to the hotel from Charles DeGaulle/Roissy airport (CDG) is easy: Take the train, RER Line B (CDG is the end of the line, so, as the signs there say, "All trains go to Paris"). Get off at the Cité Universitaire stop. Get on Tram Line 3 in the direction of Pont du Garigliano. Get off at the Brancion stop. Walk approx. 4 blocks north and the hotel will be on your right. There is a Pharmacy ("Pharmacie") and small market right next door. There is a larger grocery store at the end of the street near the Tram stop, and an even larger one 2 blocks north on Rue Brancion, then one block west on Rue de Vouillé. There are several great restaurants up and down Rue Brancion (I highly recommend Pizza Paparotti), as well as 3 bakeries (Max Poilâne is excellent) and a laundromat. In the next block, there is a large park (Parc Georges Brassens) frequented by joggers and with a children's play area. The biggest negative we experienced is the fact that there are no ice buckets in the rooms nor is there an ice machine (and no refrigerator either). Fine wine is ridiculously inexpensive in France, but it is not often available chilled. Without ice, there is no way to chill the wine (or any other drinks) in your room. We also noticed part way thru our visit that the safe in the closet was not actually affixed to the wall, though this was most likely an oversight in only our room. There are coffee and tea making facilities in the room. The coffee and tea is not replenished after the first day, but this was not a problem for us as we simply bought some coffee at the market next door. If you stay 5 or more nights, you get a huge discount off the advertised price (around 50%). We paid 53€ per night for the first few nights, then the rate went down to 49€ on 01 Aug. I highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely stay again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: fmilic
Reviews.Content: This spring we stayed there for a couple of nights. Rooms and toilete were very clean but small. Anyhow quite large enough for somebody just sleeping there. Not far from frequent bus stops. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifipixie
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 9 nights, just back home. the price was around 450euro for the 9 nights. quite cheap between me and my boyfriend. the room was small but very clean with a fantastic bed and nice little balcony and a great tv. the only flaw i would say is that the only two english channels were both news channel ( i know holidays isn't for tv watching but its nice to pass the time in the morning and chilling out after a day exploring). the hotel is a tiny bit out for central paris but a metro stop is 10 min stroll away. the hotel is in a great area, with supermarkets, fruit and bakery shops near by, with a huge market on tues, thurs and saturdays. also lovely restaurants. the breakfast was 8euro which we skipped, instead buying a piece of fruit and pastry in local shops which worked out far cheaper. the staff were friendly and very helpful. when i return to Paris, i will book into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: elainefBurnabyBC
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable, affordable and basic. We a good stay at Home Moderne, the staff were friendly and helpful and they spoke English. We enjoyed the location since it was not right in the tourist section. We walked to the Eiffel Tower and the Metro is within easy reach. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, bakeries, stores etc close by. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Uncleclean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days with my girlfriend. Hotel is nice and rooms are clean. There is a LCD TV and kettel on a table. Even if the hotel is not situated in the city center, It's not problem to walk to Eiffel tower. We were satisfied and probably will come back when in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean, Inexpensive, accessible, value for money”
Reviews.Author: SP_ORD
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. We stayed there for a couple of nights. It's in a very safe neighborhood of Paris. We walked to the hotel from the train station (which is about 6-7 blocks away) late night without any problem. It's inexpensive, free wi-fi, clean. Overall a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel made our trip to Paris great”
Reviews.Author: Leetherees
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location and very friendly staff (good English), nice size room and good breakfast. Thank you so much we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for a Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: esthercharlotte
Reviews.Content: A simple but very modern and very nice hotel at an incredible price (we got a special rate, 52 euros per night, for booking more than three nights - significantly cheaper than most of the hostels we looked at). The only reason for the low price, that I can tell, is that it's in the 15th arr., about 10 minutes' walk from the nearest metro station, and then a 10-minute ride to the centre of Paris. The extra journey time wasn't really a hardship for us and the Paris metro is cheap and efficient. The neighbourhood is very quiet, residential, middle class, with some great restaurants and patisseries very near the hotel, and several supermarkets. The room was small but not ridiculously tiny, no view to speak of, the TV had two English-language news channels and the rest was in French, the bed was comfortable although not quite firm enough for my boyfriend, the shower pressure and temperature were good, and the room was cleaned each day. It's pretty hard to complain about a hotel in Paris for that price, and there was nothing to complain about anyway. Highly recommended for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: CTricity
Reviews.Content: If like us, you are more interested in a quiet night's sleep and value for money than being right in the centre of the action then this is just the hotel for you. It is really easy to find from the metro station and is nestled and a great neighbourhood featuring corner shops, bakeries, patisseries and some really nice affordable restaurants. The rooms are larger than what you would expect in a budget hotel and are very clean. We never had the breakfast since the bakeries around near the hotel were so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and modern!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaVentura_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the 15 e of Paris so it is about a 10 minute metro ride from the city center. The neighborhood is wonderful and has a yummy pastierre up the street. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and has a very yummy breakfast - best we had in Europe. Concierge was friendly and helpful. Parc Georges is located closeby and has a wonderful outdoor bookstore and concerts on Sunday which was relaxing and fun to people watch at - a good break from sightseeing. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good look”
Reviews.Author: Attakorn
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel due to its price, good customer reviews and good looking pictures and I think we have to say the rooms and hotel do look great. It's clean, relatively modern and not cramped as cheap city hotels normally are. However, we were not too keen regarding the staff there. First, I had a problem with the booking. It was a mistake on my side to book a date which is 1 day earlier than the correct one so I immediately cancelled the room and booked another one on the correct date. I did see in the terms and conditions that the booking is non-refundable but I was hoping for some understanding as this is not a normal cancellation but an immediate cancellation to a mistake (so they couldn't have possibly incurred any opportunity cost due to my first booking). I sent them an email and they didn't give me a refund, and even saying 'no, it hasn't happened to me' in response to my statement something along the lines of 'I ask for your understanding as I'm sure it probably have happened to you before!'. It's unnecessary customer insult. What they did is perfectly correct to their rules but dealing with these situations is something that separates the goods and the greats in a service business. Second hiccup I had was, the location was a little difficult to find. It isn't next to the underground nor is it next to the main road and the pin on google maps isn't accurate enough so I decided to call the hotel. We were checking in quite late, around 11pm-midnight and the sole staff at the reception, despite being a nice gentleman, did not speak good enough English to provide directions over the phone. We had to wait for a random person to come along and hope they have heard of the hotel before. Luckily, we found someone. All in all, a pleasant experience for the stay but not for the service side.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: principal078
Reviews.Content: The accomodation was so perfeckt. Especially the cleanness, and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations, we will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: petsabino
Reviews.Content: This was with no doubts the best hotel in my whole trip. The rooms were very good and very clean with a lot of space, the bathroom was pretty good indeed with an amazing shower and the staff were also great. I recommend 110% this hotel and it will be my spot every time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Inexpensive, Great breakfast and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: alibrarianne
Reviews.Content: As many of the other reviews state, the hotel is a little bit of a walk from the Metro, but really it's only a 10 minute walk from two different metro lines. The hotel was very clean and well kept. Others have commented on the small bathrooms - but this is Paris, they will be small, especially at such a reasonable rate. They offer a breakfast for 8 euros a day, which I found to be quite reasonable given that you had unlimited coffee, juice, bread and fruit. Breakfast also included a croissant, cheese, yougurt, meat and eggs. I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel particularly if you don't want to stay in the busy central area.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: dclement04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a pretty convenient hotel in relation to public transportation. Getting to the hotel was a bit of a struggle though. We got off of the tram from University Centre stop and had to take another tram about 5 minutes away to get to the street (Rue Brancion), however the hotel was not quite at the top of the hill. We had to drag our luggage all the way down the hill until we found the hotel. Now mind you this wouldn't have been so bad if we decided to catch a cab but we were trying to save money (cabs are expensive). If you have the money and you have alot of luggage I would splurge on a cab to take you the rest of the way. We didn't complain that much though because that was part of our adventure. :) It was very clean and quiet. The staff was helpful and accommodating. We did a lot of walking and the tram station to take you to the center of the action (Eiffel Tower, Champs de Mars, Notre Dame, etc.) was quite close to the hotel. The rooms of the hotel were very nice. We were told they had renovated multiple rooms last year and we told them they did an excellent job. Small but clean. This was the perfect place to stay on a budget. We will recommend this hotel to friends and others and will be back ourselves. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kruso
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel not very far from metro/tram station, a lot of local stores around. Clean and comfort, but rooms are little bit small. Soundproof of rooms may be improved. Overall very good value for your money especially if booked well ahead and you get up to 50% discount to public price.

Reviews.Title: “Modest and convinient”
Reviews.Author: dan100200z
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Paris' Home Moderne hotel at a very late time of the night (11:30pm) and were warmly greeted by one of the hotel staff at the front desk. We were then guided to our room on the fourth floor which was modest and small but very well kept, clean and tidy. We found the sleep quality to be fine and noise levels to be very quiet and tranquil. The bathroom was a tad on the small side and amenities such as tea, coffee, soap and shampoo were not replaced after having been used once. There are very few issues to speak of regarding Home Moderne. It's close to the subway, markets and various cafes and even a Carrefour. There's no reason why I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking for an affordable, no fuss stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “That is ok”
Reviews.Author: o160
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel Clean small room Not too far from metro or tram Free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but too far away”
Reviews.Author: LisanCharlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. We thought we would enjoy staying farther outside the city, away from all the tourists. We did enjoy the fantastic local restaurants, but the nearest metro stops are all a good ten-minute walk (if you're going fast), and it takes two trains to get into the city. That said, Paris is a very large city, so you're going to have to take a train no matter where you stay if you want to see it all. The desk staff was adequate, not all that friendly. There are lots of grocery stores nearby (but no refrigerator). The room was large and clean, wood floors. The bed was comfortable and the TV was very nice (we watched a lot of the French Open). The bathroom was also nice. Overall, it was a little expensive considering how inconvenient the location is, but that might be what you can expect in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, and Great Deal for Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl418
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel was small it had everything you need. Unlike staying down south when you travel Europe all you really need is a place to sleep and a place to shower- which is exactly what Hotel Home Moderne gave us. The rooms were always very VERY clean and the staff was friendly, helpful and very respectful. The rooms dont have anything much extra, just the basics you would find, but it was all we really needed. The hotel is located a short trek away from all the major sites, it never took us more than 20 minutes on the Metro to get anywhere we needed to get within central Paris! The location is great because it is away from the "tourist" areas, which made it a lot less busy than the areas that are concentrated near the tourist attractions! The only complaint I would have is that the walls are very thin, so it was very easy to hear what was going on in the neighbouring rooms if things get rowdy. But the staff are very quick to remind people they need to stay quiet. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, clean and safe place to stay within central Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KatieandTom_10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Home Moderne for one night on the 25th May before going to the French Open at Roland Garros. The first thing I have to say is that the hotel was excellent value for money in Paris, which is very expensive hotel-wise. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro and is on a quiet street. The hotel is lovely inside and very clean. Check-in was easy. Our room was on the 5th floor, it was small but very clean and well done and had a nice ensuite. We didnt eat at the hotel but breakfast was 8 euros if you wanted it. We went to one of the many local boulangerie's for brekkie and spent a lot less than 8 euros. One problem we did have, which didnt actually directly affect us but did the people underneath us, was that in the morning when we showered the water was all falling onto the people in the room below us. When we tried to tell the reception lady, she didnt understand what we were trying to tell her and told us to just have a shower. Once the people from the room below down there told her (they were french) she soon told us not to 'just have a shower'. All in all it was a pleasant stay for us, maybe not for the people below us though.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable room, helpful staff, far from Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: mkay206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights here. Our goal of spending less than $200 per night was achieved which is a challenge in Paris. The room was quite large, quiet and clean, though basic. The front desk was very helpful in arranging our transportation to the airport. We did not partake of the breakfast offering. Our big disappointment was the long walk to the nearest Metro stop, probably about 8 blocks and at least 15 mins for most.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxocso
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel with friendly stuff. The rooms are cleaned, towels are changed every day. Big LCD TV in the room. It's a 15 minutes walking distance from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Abhilash S
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked 01 night stay. We though we will continue the stay if we like the hotel. At reception they have given us the key. when we opened the room we realized that it was too small. we went down to reception and asked him to give us another room. He has given us the key but he told us that it is almost the same size and he was absolutely right. We decided to be in the hotel as it was 11:30 in the night. The hotel is far from the city. the first thing in the morning is checking out as we can't stay in such a small room. People who are interested in Nightlife or walk around stay away...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean hotel, excellent room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pvesse
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and our baby three years old stayed three nights in the suite #309. We booked on internet without problems. Already from the arrival we were greeted well by the staff. The room was very clean and spacious. The only drawback could be the temperature in the room, in the days of our stay the temperature in Paris was very hot but the air conditioning had not yet been activated, opening the window you miss the good silencing effect. In the room there are available a safe, a mini fridge and a kettle for tea. The hotel also provides free wi-fi asking username and password at the reception. We never had breakfast at the hotel. Near the hotel there's a beautiful park. The underground stations are a little distant but the hotel is well served by bus, you can easily get to line 89.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: latitude53er
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel soley based off of Trip Advisor reviews. The reviews said that Home Moderne Hotel was clean, renovated, had free wi-fi and was in a safe neighborhood. All of that is precise. And now I realize how good of a find this is, and how lucky we are to be staying here. The neighborhood here, while not in the middle of the tourist zone, is intersting and friendly, and full of regular Parisians doing their thing. There is a fabulous Italian pizzaria and restaurnat just around the corner - La Bettola d'Alfredo - 77 Rue des Morillons - is a fabulous little place with a friendly atmosphere. The metro is a 10-minute walk, but you can take bus #95 from Rue des Morillons (right around the corner) all the way through St. Germain de Pres straight to the Louvre and Tuilleries Gardens. You get to see a lot of Paris from above ground, and this bus goes straight into the main tourist zone. As far as taking the Metro at night goes, we have done so without having to wait more than 2-4 minutes when tranferring. Public transportaion is fantastic in this city and has not been an issue at all. Like everyone has said, the rooms here are clean and small but just fine. We stayed in the front of the hotel and did not experience any issues with noise. You can book great rates off of the hotels website. This hotel really is a find in a city where places to sleep do not come cheap. I'd stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousBangkok
Reviews.Content: A very suitable, clean, and well decorated room with a mini-balcony would be the definition of this nice affordable hotel. Though, it is in 15th Arrondisement, the public transportation is quite well. Staying for five days, tram line 3 was my choice, which is within 5 minute walk from the hotel. The tram has their stops, which connects to many metro lines and also RER line B to both CDG and Orly Airport. The staffs were also nice and willing to give you thier hands as much as they could do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully clean”
Reviews.Author: Darien45
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter for her spring break. The room was small with two twin beds, but just the right size for us. The room was always clean, the beds made when we returned and the bathroom cleaned with fresh towels. And the shower was always hot and strong. Our room was on the road side of the building and it got a little loud at night with the traffic, but we didnt ask to switch rooms but sure we could have. It adds to the atmosphere of travel. Tried the breakfast the last morning and again, clean, nice area with mainly juice, coffee and pastries. It is a little bit away from the main attractions, but only a 10 minute walk at best to either the T-3 or Metro. Very nice, very clean, very affordable. The desk clerks were as helpful as any other French people when asked, but not overly friendly as a rule.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and perfect for family stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: manyadm
Reviews.Content: We had the option of more days in Paris at a more reasonable hotel a little further out, or fewer days for a place closer in; we chose the former and are so glad! This hotel was perfect for our needs: very reasonable, cozy, great for kids. The neighborhood is a real working one, so we felt like "locals" for the 10 days we were there. Lots of nearby restaurants; fabulous max poilane croissant on the same block (skip the hotel's pricey breakfast), very close to metro, and right by Brassens parc which was enormously helpful for 5 year old (and 10 year old, too!). Weekends have the book fair right there which was also fun. metro makes everything close. Only regret is we didn't really figure out the bus, which runs right in front and might have made for even quicker travel. Staff super-friendly and helpful. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: andytraveltips
Reviews.Content: 4 adults in a room and still space to move. Actually, the main reason for booking was because we could get 4 adults into a room, and the price was very reasonable (check the hotel website directly for deals) Quiet area- mainly residential. Was good to be out of the hustle every night. Good bakeries along the same road and fruit stalls and a supermarket on the corner. We found the quickest and less stressful way to get to the Eiffel Tower area was to take the tram and change onto the train - less changes and less walking around the subway connections. Not a central location, but if you dont mind travelling a bit to get to everywhere every day, its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Senior and 10 year old grandson.”
Reviews.Author: bolliCA
Reviews.Content: Small, very clean rooms with a very good breakfast. My grandson spent extra time looking out the window or using the free WiFi. Good location close to stores, reaturants, a small outdoor market and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, wonderful price”
Reviews.Author: meeshy9842
Reviews.Content: I am a student and when I decided to go to Paris, I wanted to try and avoid hostels. This is a difficult thing to do considering how expensive Paris is, but we were able to find this hotel which was a wonderful deal. We probably ended up paying less or about the same that we would have paid to stay in an average hostel. The neighborhood is safe, it is less than 10 minute walk to the metro (and the bakery that boasts 'the best baguette in Paris'!), and there is free wifi. There was a mix up with our reservation (they told us we could have more people in one room than there was actually space for) but instead of charging us extra, they gave us an extra room free of charge. The night manager is a complete sweetheart. We were delayed and arrived after our schedule check-in time and it was no problem. I absolutely recommend this place, not only for students looking to avoid hostels & not spend a fortune, but also to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tea bag”
Reviews.Author: NickandShe
Reviews.Content: A clean but basic modern hotel that was as we expected from other reviews on this sight. The only odd thing was that the mugs in the room were washed but the tea bags and coffee sachets were not replaced

Reviews.Title: “Great value; friendly; nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Canuck_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: Dear reader, we don't know each other, but I'm going to tell you that this hotel is all you need for your trip to Paris. The hotel is located in a residential neighbourhood, which means that rather than being surrounded by tourists and the establishments that cater to them (tacky shops, overpriced restaurants etc.), you will be surrounded by Parisians and the types of places they frequent (bakeries, cafes etc.). Within a ~12 minute walk of the hotel, there are two metro stations with trains to the city (Plaincances – line 13 and Convention – line 12) and five minutes away there is a tramway stop (Brancion - Tramline 3) where you can get a tram to RER B (which takes you to the airport). The hotel itself is very clean and neat. We visited in January, and found the rooms well heated and the shower to have plenty of hot water. The rooms are pretty small, but if (like us) you are there to see Paris, it won't bother you, as you will only be sleeping at the hotel. We found staff at the hotel to be friendly. Rather than have breakfast at the hotel, we opted to get our breakfast from the neighbourhood bakeries and the fruit stand across the street. Also, one morning we went to the café across the road from Plaicances metro (which, was excellent).

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marc027
Reviews.Content: Safe location, 5-10 minutes walk from metro. Comfortable bed, good shower. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Cheap option....but only the basics.”
Reviews.Author: nikoskarav
Reviews.Content: Really cheap price for a hotel in Paris.They cleaned our room and they changed towels and toilet papers every day. The room was very small. You will need 5-10 minutes on foot to approach the closest metro station. It is not very close to the city centre. One good point is that this hotel offers free Wi-fi. The breakfast costs 6 euros per person per day and it is poor,just 2 pieces of bread with nutella or jam and coffee or tea. Although, other hotels in Paris charge more than 6 euros per person. The shuttle service to the airport is not working properly, and of course its not free of charge. I would recommend this hotel if you dont want to spend a lot of money and if you spend almost the whole day outside of the hotel, as there are no facilities in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: BDEurope
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Home Moderne during the first week of July, 2010. Although access to the hotel from the nearest subway (5 mins walk, 10 mins with luggage) can be off putting, the neighborhood itself is safe and quiet. I was accompanied by 6 of my students and although the area does not have much entertainment and dining options, Rue de la Convention, which runs perpendicular to the rue Brancion, is host to restaurants, cafes, shops, and a cinema. The boulangerie at the corner of the hotel was perfect for breakfast on the go. Once we settled in, the distance did not play a factor. We were able to vist Paris during the day and return to a semblance of home in the evening. The little Italian restaurant next to the hotel was amazing and very moderately priced. The hotel was clean. The service was friendly and efficient. The rooms were indeed 'Moderne' and the kids loved the free wi-fi. Quiet hotel with the benefits of being in Paris without the bussle. I am planning a trip in 2012 and plan on staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ccbirdnerd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on our last night in France. While the location wasn't optimal (not super close to metro stops nor were there very many restaurants to choose from) the hotel staff and the quality of the establishment was superb. The receptionist was very sweet and accommodating, and the room was small but served its purpose well. My only complaint was that the continental breakfast consisted of a single croissant and a basket of bread. That's it! I know that the French don't eat large breakfasts, but that seemed a little extreme. This hotel also provided an airport shuttle for a very reasonable price, which we were very grateful for since the metro with large suitcases is a pain and taxis are very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Shmatz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within a residential area and a little bit quiet but don't let that deter you from choosing it as your place of stay in Paris. For its room rates (which are really good and reasonable) the rooms are modern and clean. The staff are very friendly and always willing to help. They were very helpful with directions and any questions I had. It is a 10 mins walk to the nearest metro station (Convention) but it's worth the walk because you get to pass through and see bakeries, restaurants, the paris cobble-stone grounds...it's a great environment to just soak in Paris apart from the popular tourist attractions. Everyone in the neighbourhood was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good value,”
Reviews.Author: jack188575
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and we very pleased with this hotel. The room and bathroom were very clean, the bed was good although it could have been a little bit bigger for us. The hotel was fully renovated in 2009, so everything was modern and nothing broken. The only negative aspect were the noises in the other rooms. As the walls were very thin you could hear everything, even the footsteps on the wooden floors in the rooms above and next to our room. So when our neighbours arrived very late, they wake you up in the middle of the night......... The breakfast was french, and the breakfastroom was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: So_very_me
Reviews.Content: I'm normally really fussy about hotels but when i first walked in to the hotel i was more then happy with it. The rooms were clean and there was no water stains or mould in the bathroom. The rooms are cleaned everyday :) and their very trustworthy... i had my laptop and expensive goods lying around the room and when i came back they were still there.... :) there are markets up the road on monday's. the beds are comfy and because the hotel is about 6-7 stations away from central paris it's really nice and quiet. there is a super market across the road, and if you need to print anything there is a printer and photocopying shop down the road who were very nice, but their english is very limited. You have the convention station about a 15 minute walk down the road or catch the T3 tram then a train at the porte de versailles station. At the station you can purchase tickets in batches of 10 for about 24 euros we used the tickets all in 4 days. The hotel staff is really helpful and pleasant and always greets you. The only thing that was not great was there was no bar fridge. But over all i would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel which is clean and courteous..... I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeeC71
Reviews.Content: I was a litle worried that the hotel is in a residential area and a little far from attractions!! All those turned out to be a good thing! The hotel is squeaky clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly with information about attractions and arranged for transportation for us to the airport on the day of our departure. The many cafes and restaurants near by offered real good food for a very reasonable price (we didn't eat at the hotel, but I saw they had breakfast available for 6 Euro per person). There were three metro stations within 10-15 minutes walk, making it very convenient to catch the appropriate train to the attraction we were going to. Internet was free and speed was decent. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to see the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: kkm099
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris several times and chose this hotel because I have friends in the area. However, I think this is a great choice if you want to get a taste of real Paris. First of all, my Paris standards, this hotel is inexpensive. The rooms are small but adequate in size. We had a pack n play set up for our baby so that made the room smaller, but it holds a queen size bed and a very small sitting area. Internet was free and a flat screen tv was on the wall. The bathroom had a shower stall and was also very small. The most important thing for us was that it was clean and it was. We did not spend any time in our room since we were out and about so in the end, the fact that the room was small was of no concern to us. We did however like the fact that there were small markets nearby and cafes, boulangeries, etc The bus let off a block away which was very convenient and it was only a 20 minute ride to all the major attractions. We had a stroller so I would highly recommend travel by bus since it is easier to maneuver the stroller on and off. The reception was friendly and we had no complaints. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: APedro
Reviews.Content: I was a bit scared about some of the hotels of Paris after reading some reviews here in the site. However, the website, photos and price of the Home Moderne convinced me to do the reservation. After 4 nights in the hotel I can say that it definitely was a very good choice. The location was very nice, in a calm, safe and clean part of the city with a lot of traditional patisseries and bistrots. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest metro station. The personnel was friendly. The rooms were modern, with plenty of space and the WC was also very good. In summary, I totally recommend the hotel and also the Creperie du Parc nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for good rate”
Reviews.Author: Kristina2003
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated two stars hotel with its cleanliness adequate three or even four star hotels in big cities. Small, but very clean and confortable rooms, with free safe deposit box and free internet access. We didn't take breakfast, because a supermarket and "boulangeries" are very close to the hotel. Hotel is located in very good area of Monparnasse disctrict, about 10-15 minutes from the nearest metro station (choose 12 line "Convention"). Service staff is friendly. I reccomend this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jillgeoff
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel.Newly modernly renovated.Great helpful staff.Breaky room had gorgeous dark lady serving Croissants, Rolls, cheeses, jams etc(why eat out)Hot Chocolate drinks the Best!!!!Loved Pizza opposite to watch him make in small cafe and buy a wine to go with it!Lovely park well worth seeing close by.Pubs with great food or (nice pasta place couple doors away to take-in.) smart walk to Train Stn. go prepared for day so you can stay out into the evening as 10 min. walk with heaps to see on the way...Even got off train one night to a night stall with wine and cheese and meats tastings.Think this mod. (our small room had Romeo and Juliet Balcony)Hotel made our 1st Paris trip so special.Better than being right in too. "Go for it" Take sneakers overseas!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, reasonable price. Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: EwanIzumo
Reviews.Content: All very modern, fresh, clean and comfortable. The only downside being that it is a little bit far out to pop back - you go out in the morning and return at night. If you are happy with that then you should be happy with this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Home Moderne
HotelInfo.Address: 61, rue Brancion, 75015 Paris, France
